CACertificateManagementAllowed.description: Allow users to manage installed CA certificates

GPO.path: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Microsoft Edge\Certificate management settings\Allow users to manage installed CA certificates

CACertificateManagementAllowed.requirements: Microsoft Edge version 133, Windows 7 or later
CACertificateManagementAllowed.description-detailed:
Setting the policy to All (0) or leaving it unset lets users edit trust settings for all CA certificates, remove user-imported certificates, and import certificates using Certificate Manager. Setting the policy to UserOnly (1) lets users manage only user-imported certificates, but not change trust settings of built-in certificates. Setting it to None (2) lets users view (not manage) CA certificates.

Policy options mapping:

* All (0) = Allow users to manage all certificates

* UserOnly (1) = Allow users to manage user certificates

* None (2) = Disallow users from managing certificates

Use the preceding information when configuring this policy.

CADistrustedCertificates.description: TLS certificates that should be distrusted by Microsoft Edge for server authentication

CAPlatformIntegrationEnabled.description: Use user-added TLS certificates from platform trust stores for server authentication

GPO.path: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\Microsoft Edge\Certificate management settings\Use user-added TLS certificates from platform trust stores for server authentication

CAPlatformIntegrationEnabled.requirements: Microsoft Edge version 133, Windows 7 or later
CAPlatformIntegrationEnabled.description-detailed:
If enabled (or unset), user-added TLS certificates from platform trust stores will be used in path-building for TLS server authentication.

If disabled, user-added TLS certificates from platform trust stores will not be used in path-building for TLS server authentication.
